question:
In which the following cases the President can appoint a judge of the Supreme Court as an acting Chief Justice of India?
1. When the office of Chief Justice of India is vacant
2. When the Chief Justice of India is temporarily absent
3. When the Chief Justice of India is unable to perform the duties of his office
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: The President of India can appoint a judge of the Supreme Court as an acting Chief Justice of India in the following cases: (1) when the office of Chief Justice of India is vacant; or (2) when the Chief Justice of India is temporarily absent; or (3) when the Chief Justice of India is unable to perform the duties of his office.
